message: Congratulations to our new Dallas County District Attorney, Faith Johnson. Throughout her career she has exhibited the utmost professionalism and a steadfast commitment to upholding our rule of law. I have no doubt that she will thrive in this new position and dedicate herself to protecting the rights of all citizens in the Dallas community.

Last November the American people entrusted Republicans with the responsibility to represent them and execute their vision for our country.  This Congress we have a historic opportunity to show Americans that they have rightly placed their faith in us to move our country forward. Today’s adoption of the rules package lays the foundation for our work ahead while building upon our continued efforts to increase transparency, improve accountability, and streamline House processes.  Read my full statement on the adoption of the Rules Package for the 115th Congress here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-applauds-adoption-rules-package

The American people are looking to Republicans to fix our broken healthcare system. It is critical that we take effective, meaningful action to address the shortcomings of the President's failed healthcare law. I was pleased to join Fox and Friends this morning to discuss my plan to repeal the most onerous parts of ObamaCare and immediately replace it with a free-market based, nondiscriminatory healthcare plan.   Watch the full interview here: https://youtu.be/Yv-vpaneTOo

For the past eight years American families and small businesses have been burdened by thousands of regulations costing billions of dollars annually. This week, House Republicans took the first step toward rolling back the Obama Administration's onerous regulatory agenda and restoring responsible regulations and congressional oversight.   Watch the following video to learn more: https://youtu.be/mM4ygeTJKoc
I was delighted to congratulate Texas' new 5A D1 state champions, the Highland Park Scots. Proud to represent such a talented group of student athletes.

Congressman Sam Johnson is an American hero who has devoted his life to preserving and protecting our freedom. It has been an honor and a privilege to serve with him in the House of Representatives. While he will be dearly missed once he retires in the 116th Congress, his legacy of patriotism will live on and never be forgotten.

These past eight years of overregulation and excessive overreach from unelected federal bureaucrats have taken a toll on our economy and drained our job market.  That’s why in these first weeks of the 115th Congress the House has passed numerous measures to responsibly reform the regulatory process, cut through unnecessary red tape, and give small businesses and American families reprieve from the Obama Administration’s onerous regulatory agenda. I proudly voted for this important measure to put an end to job killing, costly regulations and put Americans back to work.  Read my full statement here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-votes-restore-integrity-administrative-procedure-act

The American people need a healthcare system that works for them, not for Washington. That is why I have introduced a freemarket - based plan that is nondiscriminatory, sustainable, and provides all Americans with the same tax advantage for healthcare.   Watch my interview on CNN to learn more: https://youtu.be/dd78zdb7cgc

This morning I was honored to join Americans from across the country at our nation’s Capitol to celebrate the peaceful transfer of power to the 45th President of the United States of America, Donald J. Trump.  With this unified government we have an historic opportunity to strengthen our great nation and get our country back on track. From fixing our broken healthcare system, to creating full time jobs, to unleashing the free-enterprise system, to reasserting our strength on the global stage – we have a lot of work to do. While the list is long, I am confident that we will work through these difficult issues thoughtfully, methodically, and effectively.  I look forward to working closely with this new Administration and Members of Congress to bolster our nation’s tradition of excellence and make our country even better, safer, and stronger.

Thousands of Americans from all corners of the country will come to Washington this weekend to march for life. I deeply appreciate their dedication to this important cause because I believe that each and every life is precious, especially the lives of innocent unborn babies. Yesterday I proudly joined my House colleagues in supporting the passage of the No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion Act. While the Hyde Amendment - a critical measure that prevents any federal funding of abortions - has been renewed for the past 41 years, I believe it is time this life-saving amendment becomes permanent law and I am pleased that we took this important step towards that goal.

As a result of President Obama's illegal and dangerous executive actions on illegal immigration, our laws have been ignored, our borders have blurred, and the safety and security of the American people has been jeopardized and countless lives lost. I am extremely pleased that President Trump has reversed this dangerous course and put a stop to these unwise and unlawful policies. Protecting the American people from criminal illegal aliens and bolstering our border security is one of my highest priorities and I am pleased to see the President take these important steps.

President Trump's nomination of Judge Neil Gorsuch comes at a pivotal time in our country. I believe that Judge Gorsuch is an exceptional choice that will defend the Constitution, preserve the principles of limited government, and uphold our nation's rule of law.   Read my full statement here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-applauds-supreme-court-nominee-announcement

Today I asked President Trump to immediately announce a delay of Obama’s fiduciary rule. This misguided rule was yet another example of the Obama Administration’s one-size-fits-all approach to governing that allowed unelected bureaucrats to make decisions without fully taking into consideration the impact it would have on American families and businesses. Now that we have a President who is committed to rolling back the flawed regulations of the Obama Administration I believe we must use this opportunity to appropriately address the shortcomings of this ruling.

This afternoon I had the privilege of speaking at the 2017 Jewish Disability Advocacy Day Luncheon. I was honored to meet with so many passionate advocates for the disabled, and will continue to fight for disability rights in Congress. #JDAD #JDAIM17

This week the I proudly voted to disapprove five unnecessary, harmful rules that were enforced in the waning days of the Obama Administration. These rules saddled employers with ill-conceived and costly requirements drowning them in paperwork and crippling their ability to grow and create jobs, decimated jobs in the coal industry, and restricted the constitutional rights of individuals with disabilities. Washington bureaucrats operating independently of Congressional direction have plagued the American people for far too long and passage of these measures today sends a clear message that enough is enough.

In North Texas a key part of our economic success has stemmed from our robust infrastructure. Bolstering our infrastructure has always been a key priority of mine. I was delighted to meet with the DART Board of Directors this morning to discuss ways we can continue to better our transportation systems in North Texas.
ICYMI: Here is my weekly newsletter, the Hill Report.

I rarely ever second guess or comment on decisions made by local officials but I feel that this unwise resolution puts our families and our community in direct harm and demands our immediate attention. It is completely irresponsible to pick and choose which laws to follow especially when it comes to turning a blind eye to the actions of criminal illegal aliens. I refuse to stand idly by and let this misguided, lawless resolution undermine our nation's laws and endanger our families.
I'm about to go LIVE on NBC DFW to discuss the Dallas County Commissioners unwise and unlawful resolution that poses a direct threat to the safety and security of our community.

ICYMI: Yesterday I joined The Mark Davis Show on 660 AM The Answer to discuss the Dallas County Commissioner's resolution that endangers our community and completely undermines our nation's rule of law.  Listen here: https://soundcloud.com/the-mark-davis-show/february-9-2017-9am-hour

Today members of my District Office team will be holding Mobile Office Hours in the cities of Sachse, Wylie, Garland, and Rowlett. Please feel free to stop by at any of the locations listed below if you have any questions or need help with a federal agency.   City of Sachse Time: 9:00 am – 1:00 pm Location: City Hall 3815 Sachse Road Sachse, Texas 75048  City of Wylie Time: 1:30 pm – 5:30 pm Location: City Hall 300 Country Club Drive #100 Wylie, Texas 75098  City of Garland Time: 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM Location: Central Library 625 Austin Street Garland, Texas 75040  City of Rowlett Time: 1:30 PM - 3:30 PM Location: City Hall 3901 Main Street Rowlett, Texas 75088
NA

For nearly a century ranchers, farmers, and families along the Red River have lived in a cloud of uncertainty because of the Bureau of Land Management’s failure to appropriately determine the boundary between public and private land.  As a result Texans have been subject to ridiculous and baseless land grabs by federal agencies. That is why I proudly voted for the Red River Gradient Boundary Survey Act to provide them with the certainty they need so they can rightfully protect their land.
This morning I was honored to receive the True Blue award from the Family Research Council for my 100% rating for my unwavering commitment to supporting religious freedom and pro-life measures.

As a result of an oppressive rule implemented by the Obama Administration, the great state of Alaska has been restricted in its ability to manage its own fish and wildlife refuges. This rule undermines state authority to oversee local wildlife for recreational and subsistence hunting and sets an alarming precedent of federal interference in our wildlife reserves if implemented across the rest of the country. That is why I proudly supported this measure to overturn this restrictive rule and work to restore a cooperative relationship between Alaska and the federal government.

I proudly voted to roll back an Obama-era mandate that forced states to fund abortion providers like Planned Parenthood. By overturning this rule we are restoring states rights and providing them with the opportunity to make their own decisions so they can support family planning and other health services without being forced to fund abortion providers.   Read my full statement here: https://sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-votes-end-obamas-title-x-abortion-funding-rule
Last night I was delighted to speak to nearly 5,000 of the Jewish community's top teen leaders, educators, professionals, and philanthropists at the BBYO International Convention in Dallas.
This morning I had a great discussion with North Texas companies and the start up community at a Cyber Security round table in Dallas.

On Saturday, March 18, 2017 at 12:30 PM I will be holding a Town Hall Meeting at Richardson High School. To RSVP and learn more about this meeting please visit my website:  https://sessions.house.gov/services/town-hall-meetings.

This morning I had a great discussion with members of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce in Dallas about the legislative state of play in Washington and my continued commitment to reforming our broken healthcare system.

This week I was delighted to join the men and women of Compass Professional Health Services in Dallas to learn more about their innovative approach to finding solutions to rising healthcare costs. By helping to provide transparency to the process, Compass helps benefits managers stretch their company's healthcare dollars by getting better care at lower costs, while ultimately empowering consumers to make better and more informed choices regarding their and their family's healthcare.

Last week I was delighted to meet with North Texans across the 32nd Congressional District. Read my weekly newsletter, The Hill Report, to learn more about these meetings, my upcoming Town Hall, and more.

Tonight the American people heard from a president who stands by his word, has gotten straight to work, and every day upholds his commitment to fight on behalf of the American people. This new administration brings a renewed sense of strength and opportunity for us to break glass and create more opportunities for Americans across the country. The American people deserve a government that works for them and I believe as a united front we will revive the American Dream and create a safer, stronger, better America.  Read my full statement on President Trump's joint address here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-statement-president-trump-s-first-joint-address-congress

ANNOUNCEMENT: My District Office is moving office locations this week so our phone lines in Dallas will be disconnected tomorrow, Thursday, March 2nd and will be reconnected on Friday, March 3rd. I'm sorry for this inconvenience but if you need any assistance or need to reach anyone in my office please call my staff in Washington, D.C. at 202.225.2231. Thank you for your understanding.

I enjoyed meeting with bright young leaders from SMU and discussing my role as Chairman of the Rules Committee, important issues facing our country, and the political climate in Texas and across the nation. It is an honor to represent these students and I'm proud to have such a wonderful university in the 32nd Congressional District.
Happy Texas Independence Day!

Earlier this week President Trump delivered a strong message to the American people that made one thing crystal clear – the days of the Obama Administration’s regulatory regime are over. We have finally turned the page and have started a new chapter for our country. One that unleashes the free-enterprise system, puts hard working Americans back to work, and creates more opportunities for all Americans.  This week the House worked to put this agenda in motion by passing three critical measures that responsibly reform our regulatory system while enforcing measures of accountability, transparency, and integrity. Regulations have run rampant these last eight years but enough is enough. Republicans have made a concerted and focused effort to eliminate unnecessary rules and regulations to give the American people the relief that they need.
I enjoyed visiting veterans at the Dallas VA with the Whiskers for Wounded Warriors this morning.

For the past seven years Obamacare has taken a toll on our economy, raised costs on hard working American families, and has derailed our healthcare system. Republicans have introduced a free market based plan that will ensure that all Americans can have affordable healthcare coverage, keeps consumer protections, and creates a sustainable, non discriminatory healthcare system.   Read more about the bill here: https://housegop.leadpages.co/healthcare/

As a proud Eagle Scout I always look forward to the annual Boy Scouts of America Report to the Nation ceremony where Scouts from across the country gather in our nation's capital to present their update to Members of Congress. Last night I was honored to address these fine young leaders and encourage them to continue to be their best and continue to honorably serve their communities.

With a heavy heart I would like to recognize the passing of a true American patriot and a man who was committed to bettering his community and country. Jerry Rehm was a civil servant, a successful businessman, and one of the most passionate advocates for the United States Merchant Marine Academy ALUMNI. Even at age 90 he would walk up and down the halls of Congress to hand out the Academy's Kings Pointer magazines and to meet with Members to further the goals of the Academy. I am deeply honored to have had the privilege to work with such a wonderful man and he will be dearly missed by all who knew and loved him.

ICYMI: Yesterday during the Rules Committee hearing on three bills to help our nation's veterans I gave a shout out to a wonderful group in North Texas - the Whiskers for Wounded Warriors. These patriots commit their lives to helping our veterans in the North Texas community. I am proud to call them my friends and I am also proud to be their representative. Thank you for all that you do.   Watch the clip here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qDoycT-La08&feature=youtu.be

We have heard story after story about  the systemic problems plaguing the VA resulting in less than mediocre care forour nation's veterans. Enough is enough. Tonight I proudly voted for the VA Accountability First Act to ensure that the employees at the VA are held accountable for their actions and that our veterans are treated the way that they deserve.
I'm getting ready to go on NBC DFW to talk about my Town Hall meeting this Saturday at Richardson High School and discuss the Republican healthcare plan to fix our broken healthcare system.

This week I proudly joined my colleagues in passing three different measures to support these brave heroes. These three bills aim to improve the lives of all veterans across the country by protecting their Second Amendment rights, creating a culture of accountability at the VA, and ensuring that the VA hires the best physicians to treat these men and women. While there is still much more that we need to do to provide our veterans with the support that they need and deserve, these important measures are a step in the right direction.

ICYMI: Yesterday I was on Fox News talking about why I believe the American Health Care Act will help fix our broken healthcare system. Obamacare has been a disaster and this week the House will vote to repeal this awful bill and replace it with a free market based, patient centered solution.   Watch the clip here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7brP4TMzP58

This morning at 9:00 AM CST I will chair the hearing on the American Health Care Act. Obamacare has been a disaster and I believe this bill is the first step to fixing our broken health care system and providing Americans with better, more affordable care.   Watch the hearing live on C-SPAN's website or on the Rules Committee's website here: https://rules.house.gov/

This morning I will chair the Rules Committee hearing on the American Health Care Act. We have an historic opportunity to finally repeal and replace Obamacare and fix our broken health care system.   Watch the hearing LIVE on C-SPAN or on rules.house.gov.

As a result of President Obama's onerous regulatory agenda, American jobs and American energy independence were placed on the chopping block. Today, President Trump took a positive step to cut through reams of unnecessary red tape and unleash the power of American energy. This action will eliminate federal overreach, restore economic freedom, and create American jobs. I'm proud to have a president who supports economic freedom and takes an active role in responsibly developing American energy.

The 2017 County Health Rankings have been released and Collin County — which I’m proud to represent — has been listed as the healthiest county in Texas. The Rankings measure the health of virtually every county in America on 30 factors that impact health, including education, transportation, housing, violent crime, jobs, diet and exercise. Learn more here: http://www.countyhealthrankings.org/app/texas/2017/overview

This week I was delighted to meet with an advocate from Dallas from the Alzheimer's Association. I admire her dedication and committment to caregiving and healing. This disease has impacted millions of Americans across the country and I believe it is critical that they have the resources they need to further research for treatments and one day find a cure to #EndAlzheimers.

Each year I am always delighted to host the Congressional Art Competition in the 32nd Congressional District.  This competition invites North Texas high school students to submit a piece of artwork that best reflects their idea of “America the Beautiful” and have their piece displayed in the United States Capitol.  If you would like to participate in this year's competition please submit your artwork by April 4th at 5 PM. Leare more here: https://sessions.house.gov/services/congressional-art-competition

This morning I was delighted to welcome members of the Richardson Chamber of Commerce to Washington to discuss critical issues impacting our communities and nation. We had a robust discussion about the importance of staying engaged and involved with what is going on not only in Washington but within our own communitites. This was an exceptional group of thought leaders who will continue to make the city of Richardson and our North Texas community a better place.

SSG Travis Mills and David Vobora have an amazing story that has not only inspired those around them but has changed the lives of hundreds of individuals who have suffered life altering injuries. I have had the distinct honor of meeting with these heroes and I am pleased to see that their story and their mission was shared with the rest of the country on the Ellen DeGeneres show.  Watch this clip to learn more about their story:

UPDATE: I have extended the deadline for the Congressional Art Competition to Friday, April 7th at 5 PM. If you are high school student in the 32nd Congressional District of Texas and would like ot participate please visit my website.   sessions.house.gov/services/congressional-art-competition

Yesterday the President made it clear that we will not stand idly by while Bashar al-Assad barbarically uses chemical weapons to take the lives of innocent men, women, and children. President Trump’s decision to launch a targeted airstrike on the airfield where Assad launched the deadly chemical attack on Monday shows a strength and responsibility that we have not seen in eight years. While the complexity of the situation in Syria grows daily, I believe this is a solid first step and I look forward to working with the President and my colleagues in Congress to hold the Assad regime accountable for its heinous actions.
NA

Each year I'm delighted to welcome high school students from the 32nd Congressional District to Washington for the Pete Sessions Leadership and Growth Program. I had a great afternoon meeting with this year's participants at the kick off party in Dallas. Special thanks to Herschel Walker for being our key note speaker.
I was delighted to present the Save 10 award to these outstanding job creators at the Financial Services Roundtable this morning.
This morning I had the opportunity to visit the fusion center in Collin County and meet with stakeholders from across North Texas to discuss security concerns facing the region.

As a nation we are facing an unprecedented number of threats ranging from terrorism threatening Americans at home and abroad and the drug epidemic plaguing our communities. This morning I had the opportunity to discuss these important issues with the North Texas Crime Commission and work through solutions to keep our North Texas families safe.

Art Competition Update: The submissions are in and we have received incredible artwork from the talented students of the 32nd Congressional District. Check out the pieces and cast your vote for the People's Choice Award here: https://sessions.house.gov/services/congressional-art-competition/2017-peoples-choice-award
NA
Last week I was delighted to meet with job creators, law enforcement agents, and constituents across North Texas. Read all about these meetings in my weekly newsletter, The Hill Report.

Last night I was delighted to celebrate the talented North Texas high school students who participated in this year's Congressional Art Competition. Each year I am blown away by the sheer talent, dedication, and professionalism of these students and this year was no different. Congratulations to Uriel Lopez from the John Leslie Patton Academic Center for receiving the grand prize for his exceptional piece, "Preserving Patriot's Dream."

At 4:30 PM CST I will be chairing the Rules Committee hearing on a measure to fund the government through next week as we continue to finalize the long term 2017 funding bill.   Watch the hearing LIVE here: https://rules.house.gov/video/rules-committee-hearing-hj-res-99

Tomorrow, Saturday, April 29, 2017, a representative from my office will be joining my North Texas colleagues in hosting a Service Academy forum.  This event provides interested students and their parents with the opportunity to learn more about our nation’s exceptional Service Academies and the important role they have in shaping the future leaders of our community, state, and nation. Hope to see you there.   Saturday, April 29, 2017 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon Registration Begins at 7:30 a.m. Mansfield ISD Center for the Performing Arts 1110 W. Debbie Lane Mansfield, Texas 76063
As a proud Eagle Scout I am always delighted to celebrate the achievements of young scouts in #TX32. Happy 40th anniversary to Troop 1020 in Rowlett.
ICYMI: Check out my weekly newsletter to learn about legislation that I introduced last week, my meetings with North Texans, and more.
NA

Our workforce has changed dramatically over the years. Whether employees are balancing a full time position while attending school or a single parent is working two jobs to provide for their children, the needs of our workforce have evolved. As our workforce changes so must our laws that protect and govern them. Currently, only public sector employees have the ability to choose paid time off instead of cash wages as compensation for working overtime hours.  Employees in both the public and private sector should have the same opportunities to balance their work and personal obligations.  That is why I proudly voted to overhaul this outdated law to provide all members of the 21st century workforce the flexibility they need and deserve.  Read more about H.R. 1180, Working Families Flexibility Act of 2017, the bill that the House just passed here: https://rules.house.gov/bill/115/hr-1180

Obamacare is a discriminatory system that picks winners, creates losers, and oppresses American people who are trying to keep their families healthy.  It is a failing system that restricts choice, makes health care unaffordable for American families, and is a major reason why our economy has seen stagnant growth since 2010.   Although today's vote is a first step to address the failures of the current health care law, we must be deliberate, thoughtful, and responsible in working to produce a sustainable solution to fix our broken healthcare system.  Health care is an issue that impacts every single American.  While this bill is not perfect, I believe it is far superior to the health care system we have now.   It is my hope that my colleagues in the Senate will continue to use this time to develop a better system that brings millions more of Americans to the health care system, not millions less.  We have a real opportunity to effectively fix health care, and I hope we can continue to work together to do so.

I had a wonderful morning meeting with students at the The Winston School and touring their exceptional campus. From learning about the completely student built solar powered car that will be raced at Texas Motor Speedway this summer, to listening to the stories of two bright young student ambassadors, to answering questions about my conservation efforts to make North Texas a better place, I had a wonderful time talking with these young leaders and I am proud to have such an exceptional school in the 32nd Congressional District.

For the past ten years I have been honored to partner with the Today Foundation and host North Texas students in Washington, D.C. through the Texas Leadership Forum. I have welcomed hundreds of bright young leaders throughout the years and this afternoon I was delighted to see one of the first students, Ashley Aguilar, at a business round table in Dallas. It is always incredible to see these young leaders grow into influencers in their community. I am immensely proud of Ashley and all that she has accomplished.

Next week, my staff will be holding Mobile Office Hours in Rowlett, Garland, Wylie, and Sachse. Please come see them if you need help with a federal agency or if you have any questions for them.   Here is the schedule:   Monday, May, 15, 2017   Rowlett  Rowlett City Hall  3901 Main Street  Rowlett, Texas 75088  9:00 AM - 12:30 PM  Garland  Garland City Hall  200 N. 5th Street  Garland, Texas 75040  1:00PM - 5:00PM  Sachse  Sachse City Hall  3815 Sachse Road  Sachse, Texas 75048  1:00 PM - 5:00PM
Great morning with students from Bishop Lynch, Wylie East and the Dallas Youth Council picking up trash at White Rock Lake.

Last week I had the opportunity to visit the Winston School, meet with Richardson Police Officers, discuss health care and education with young professionals in Dallas, and more.   Read more about my meetings last week in my newsletter, the Hill Report: sessions.house.gov/media-center/weekly-newsletters/hill-report-week-may-8-12-2017

This week is dedicated to celebrating the men and women who put their lives on the line each and every day to keep our families safe. I sincerely appreciate their committment and willingness to go above and beyond to protect our communities. #PoliceWeek #BackTheBlue
UPDATE: My staff will hold Mobile Office Hours in Wylie, Monday, May 22, 2017 from 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm at Wylie City Hall, 300 Country Club Dr #100, Wylie, Texas 75098  9:00 AM - 12:30 PM.

The officers of the Dallas Police Department are some of the finest in the nation. It was an honor to welcome two officers from the department to Washington this morning. Their professionalism, bravery, and unwavering commitment to protecting our community has been displayed time and time again and I could not be prouder to represent these fine officers.

At 4:00 PM CST I am chairing the House Committee on Rules - Republicans hearing on two bills to support our police officers:  H.R. 115 - Thin Blue Line Act and H.R. 1039 - Probation Officer Protection Act of 2017.   Watch the hearing live here: https://rules.house.gov/video/rules-committee-hearing-hr1039-and-hr-115

It was an honor to have Dr. Bruce Hargrave from Rowlett, Texas lead the United States House of Representatives in prayer as the guest chaplain yesterday morning. As a faith leader, civil servant, and trusted advisor, Bruce plays an integral role in his community and I am honored to have such a fine citizen in the 32nd Congressional District.  https://youtu.be/FZ_ULCh4mfU

Former FBI Director Mueller is a well-qualified leader who is more than capable to lead this independent investigation. He has gained overwhelming bipartisan respect for his fidelity to the truth and his commitment to the rule of law. I believe that it is critical that we get to the bottom of this once and for all and Mueller is the person to do exactly that.

ICYMI: Read my weekly newsletter to catch up on the bills that the House passed last week to support our nation's police officers, hear about my meetings with North Texans in Washington, and more.   Read the Hill Report here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/weekly-newsletters/hill-report-week-may-15-19-2017

My deepest sympathies go out to the families, victims, and all who were impacted by the horrific attack in Manchester last night. Today and always, America stands hand in hand, heart to heart, with our friends in England. This vicious act further deepens our resolve to eviscerate the evil, immoral radical Islamic terrorists who continue to threaten our friends across the globe and our freedom.

As a fiscal conservative, one of my top priorities has always been to scale down our bloated budget and get our fiscal house in order. While I agree with some of the over-arching principles of President Trump's budget proposal - balancing in ten years, increasing spending for our men and women on the front lines, and reducing the deficit - the Constitution squarely places the power of the purse within the control of Congress.  My colleagues are already hard at work to put forth a budget that stimulates economic growth and eliminates wasteful programs. We must pass a budget that ensures our military has the resources they need to protect our nation both at home and abroad as well as fund programs that are critical to our communities. I look forward to working with my colleagues in Congress to responsibly fund our government and wisely use taxpayer dollars to put our nation back on the path towards fiscal stability.

This Memorial Day I am honored to be with the United States Marine Corps to thank them for their service and their unwavering commitment to protecting our great nation.  Watch my Memorial Day message here: https://youtu.be/8_DdnFrCVbA

To stay up to date with my work in the 32nd Congressional District and to receive legislative updates, make sure to sign up for my weekly newsletter, The Hill Report.   Learn more here: https://sessions.house.gov/contact/newsletter
NA

This morning I was delighted to host a congressional briefing with former Secretary of the Navy John Lehman, North Texans representing the Navy League, and policymakers to discuss vital role the United States Navy plays in our national security and why we must seize the opportunity to grow the fleet.
Today marks the 73rd anniversary of D-Day. May we never forget the brave heroes who stormed the beaches of Normandy in the name of freedom.

ICYMI: This morning I joined Fox & Friends friends to discuss important measures to end loopholes and prevent radical terrorists from posing harm to our communities.   Watch the clip here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qtkSnYBrLVU

Under President Trump's leadership, Secretary Kelly has made a concerted effort to provide the necessary resources to secure our porous borders and uphold our rule of law. However, our border patrol - the most critical resource we have on the ground - is severely understaffed. I proudly voted for H.R. 2213, the Anti-Border Corruption Reauthorization Act of 2017 to appropriately address this problem by allowing already thoroughly vetted candidates to expeditiously go through the  hiring process and begin their important duties of protecting our borders. These individuals are critical to the safety and security of our nation and we must responsibly ensure we have enough officers on the ground to protect our borders.

I was pleased to meet with Texans from Experian Murray Johnston, Lee Lundy and Joseph Manna to discuss possible reofrms to the Credit Repair Organizations Act or CROA. Specifically, we discussed a narrow fix designed to address a critical situation that left unattended, will greatly harm families in North Texas and across the nation. I look forward to continuing to work with them to resolve this important issue to avoid disastrous implications for North Texans.

Today the House turned the page on the era of onerous regulations and passed a measure to create real economic growth that allows our free-enterprise system to thrive. Under the leadership of Chairman Jeb Hensarling, this package responsibly rights the wrongs of Dodd-Frank by bringing accountability to the financial services industry, stopping taxpayer bailouts, and providing all Americans, regardless of their circumstances, the opportunity to achieve financial independence. Importantly, this legislative package also repealed the misguided and flawed Department of Labor Fiduciary Rule. I proudly supported this measure to unleash our economic prowess and reinvigorate our American economy.  Read my full statement here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-votes-roll-back-dodd-frank

One of my biggest honors as a Member of Congress is appointing young leaders to our nation's Service Academies. This morning I was delighted to celebrate these exceptional students. This event would not have been possible without the hard work and commitment of my Service Academy Liaison, Rachel Garcia. Rachel, it has been an honor to have you on my team and thank you for your years of service in my office.

ICYMI: In last week's newsletter I highlighted my votes to roll back onerous Dodd-Frank regulations and to bolster national security.   Read more in The Hill Report here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/weekly-newsletters/hill-report-week-june-12-16-2017
We have a busy week at the Rules Committee. See our schedule below and watch the hearings live here: https://rules.house.gov/.

This year I was delighted to nominate 11 young leaders to our nation's Service Academies. These young men and women represent the best and brightest of our community and I am honored to serve as their representative.   Read my full statement here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/pete-sessions-announces-appointment-11-north-texas-students-us-service

Today I proudly voted to send a bill to the President’s desk that makes it clear we are serious about reforming the VA and showing our veterans that we are working to make sure they have the care they need and deserve. I’m proud this bill will imminently be signed into law and remain committed to fighting for our Veterans who have so bravely fought to preserve our freedom. I am horrified by the news of my colleauges being the target of unwarranted violence at the Congressional Baseball practice this morning. My prayers are with my friend Congressman Steve Scalise, his staff, and all who were injured this morning.

Last night I was proud to come together with all my colleagues, staff members, and Americans to celebrate the age-old tradition of the Congressional Baseball Game. While this has been a difficult week, it was a wonderful night honoring our friend Congressman Steve Scalise with a display of strength, unity, and patriotism.

My father was always been my biggest role model. He taught me the importance of giving back to your community through Scouting, serving your country as a public servant, and being the best father I can be to my five sons. I will be forever grateful for the lessons my dad has taught me and the unwavering love he has always showed me. Happy Father's Day! This morning I was delighted to introduce Secretary Rick Perry  at the SelectUSA Investment Summit hosted by Secretary of Commerce Wilbur Ross. This event underscores our commitment to reinvigorating our local economies and putting Americans back to work.

As the proud Co-Chair of the Yellow Pages Caucus I was delighted to talk to members of the group this morning. During today's discussion we specifically talked about the potential role of public-private partnerships in infrastructure development.  This caucus is comprised of Members of Congress who believe that we should rely upon the private sector to provide commercially available goods and services to the government and the American people.

Yesterday I was delighted to sit down with North Texas representatives from Charter Communications to discuss the important new developments in the telecommunications industry. This industry has created 2,934 jobs in 32nd Congressional District of Texas alone and has had a $438 million economic impact on our North Texas region. Charter is an example of the success of the free enterprise system and I look forward to continuing to work with them to create jobs for hard working North Texans and grow our local and national economy.

We have heard a lot of talk about Washington’s inability to work together. However, this week, the House passed a bipartisan jobs bill with overwhelming support from both sides of the aisle. This bill underscores our ability to come together to deliver results for the American people by passing legislation that will directly impact American families, our economy, and our labor force. Last Friday I was honored to participate in the wreath laying ceremony at the Korean War Veterans Memorial with Vice President Pence and the President of the Republic of Korea, Moon Jae-in. As the son of a Korean War Veteran it was a moving ceremony to honor and remember these brave heroes. It was particularly special because my father was the one who spoke the words enshrined in the granite at the monument. I could not be prouder to be his son and to have been a part of this beautiful ceremony to honor the men who “answered the call to defend a country they never knew and a people they never met."

Today we join together in the bonds of liberty to celebrate our great nation. Let us give thanks for our freedom and the brave men and women who put their lives on the line each and every day to defend it. I would like to wish everyone in North Texas and across the country a happy and safe Fourth of July.
Happy Birthday to my fellow Texan and friend who I'm proud to represent in TX32, President George W. Bush.

Today marks the one year anniversary of the tragic events that shook our city and put our police officers in the direct line of fire. When the shooter opened fire, they didn’t run away or cower. They did what they were trained to do and because of that they saved countless innocent lives. As we remember these fallen officers, I would also like to take a moment to recognize all of the men and women who selflessly serve and protect our community day in and day.
Congratulations to my friend Frank Millsap and all of my friends at Sachse Rod Shop on their 35th anniversary.

Under current law, physicians and other DEA licensed medical practitioners are barred from transporting controlled substances from one practice setting to another. In addition to restrictions, there is a lot of uncertainty surrounding the compliance with certain methods of transportation which has created another hurdle between patients and physicians. To address this issue, I have received feedback from rural doctors and members of the Dallas community, including Dr. Dan Cooper, the physician for the Dallas Cowboys. As a result of their hard work, persistence, and leadership,  I am delighted that the House passed my bill, H.R. 1492, the Medical Controlled Substances Transporation Act, to support mobile physicians and the millions of Americans who rely upon their essential services.

I am deeply saddened to learn that one of the Marines that was killed in the crash earlier this week was from my district in Dallas. Karen and I would like to offer our heart felt condolences to the Snowden family as they navigate this difficult time and mourn the loss of their beloved son.

As a proud Eagle Scout I was delighted to welcome more than 400 North Texas Scouts to the U.S. Capitol before we all head to the National Jamboree this weekend.

ICYMI: Since 1908, we have reduced ozone levels by nearly one-third and they are continuing to trend downward. However, currently, states are facing the prospect of simultaneously complying with two different sets of standards which is confusing, costly, and inefficient. Yesterday the House passed a bill that builds upon the progress that we have made while giving states more time to comply with these standards. I believe it is critical that we continue to make strides in cleaning our air while providing states with more flexibility so we can ensure communities aren’t saddled with regulatory costs that stifle job creation and cripple our economy.  https://www.dallasnews.com/news/politics/2017/07/18/house-approves-texans-bill-delay-obama-era-ozone-standards-reducing-pollution
Every summer I am delighted to welcome North Texans with the Texas Leadership Forum to our nation's Capitol building. #TX32

In the wake of September 11th, the Department of Homeland Security was created to better protect our country from looming threats. Today, the United States faces dynamic national security challenges ranging from the ISIS, human traffickers, drug smugglers, and terrorists who are waging cyber war fare. We live in a dangerous time and now more than ever it is critical that we ensure we have the resources necessary to stay ahead of the ever-evolving threats to our great nation. This week I proudly voted on a measure that takes a comprehensive approach to reauthorizing this critical department.

Yesterday I had the opportunity to tour the North Texas Food Bank and help package meals for North Texas families. This organization provides more than 190,000 meals to seniors, children, and families in our region. I am delighted to have such a wonderful organization in our community.

As the proud father of a Down syndrome young man, I find it horrifying and disgusting that people are celebrating the termination of individuals with disabilities. I wish more people understood that we should celebrate their lives and give them the unconditional love and support that they deserve, not work to extinguish these gifts from God.

Yesterday I was pleased to join my North Texas colleagues at the Dallas Chamber of Commerce's annual Congressional Forum. I am so proud to have such a wonderful organization fueled by the kindness and generosity of the community.

I enjoyed touring the new Citi Omni Channel Command Center this morning in North Texas. In addition to the tour, I also had the opportunity to sit down with employees to discuss tax reform, health care, and other legislative items that we will address before the end of the year.

I am aware that stations in North Texas are experiencing a shortage of gas but have been assured that this should only be a short term interruption. Today the EPA exercised its emergency fuel waiver authority and the Department of Energy authorized the release of 1.5 million barrels oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve in order to help ensure an adequate supply of fuel throughout the country.   If you are trying to find a gas station to fill up your tank, go to this website to find the station closest to you: http://tracker.gasbuddy.com/MobileSearch.aspx

I have always believed that President Obama's immigration policies were unwise, unlawful, and unconstitutional. His actions completely disregarded our nation’s rule of law and undermined Congress' Article I authority. Today’s announcement corrects this wrong by putting the responsibility to address this important issue squarely where it belongs – in the hands of Congress. As a Member of Congress, it is my duty to address these important issues and I look forward to working with my colleagues to put forth a long-term solution that makes our country stronger, safer, and upholds our nation’s rule of law.

Last week Hurricane Harvey wreaked havoc in Southern Texas and Louisiana causing an unimaginable level of devastation. However, through the rubble and disaster we saw an incredible outpouring of love, compassion, and sense of community. Neighbors were helping neighbors, strangers were caring for strangers, and fellow Texans and Americans from across the state and country swiftly came to the aid of the thousands of individuals who were hurting from this storm. Today, the House voted to bolster the efforts of all who have lent their support  to the relief efforts by fulfilling the full request from the Administration for emergency relief funding. While this is the first step in a long road ahead, we will continue to support the efforts to rebuild these communities and help our fellow Americans get back on their feet.

As the proud father of a St. Mark's School of Texasgraduate, it is always wonderful to see my son’s classmates grow up and learn about their success. Knowing Emmanuel Acho since he was a teenager, I can say that he has always been a genuine, kind, and wonderful young man and I am so proud of all he has achieved. Yesterday I was delighted to welcome him to the Capitol and learn about his efforts to help VICIS in promoting their new line of impact reducing football helmets to protect players from short term and long term injuries.

I am immensely proud of my fellow Texans and Americans who have come together to address the needs of our nation and support our neighbors. Harvey was a once in 500 year storm that will forever leave a mark on our communities. While this is still a fresh memory, our neighbors in Florida are bracing for two more storms that could potentially be as devastating, if not more devastating, than Harvey. With these natural catastrophes looming, it is even more imperative that we provide the resources necessary to ensure FEMA has what they need to help all who will be impacted by this storm. Thousands of Americans have been impacted by Harvey and unfortunately, thousands will feel the devastation of the storms quickly approaching our shore. I supported today’s measure because I believe it will provide necessary relief and resources to help our fellow Americans as they face an extraordinarily difficult time.

This morning I was delighted to meet with Texas job creators from the Texas Association of Business to discuss tax reform and the legislative agenda for the rest of the year. Tax reform is a critical issue that must be addressed in order to allow businesses to be competitive and give them the opportunity to grow their businesses so they can continue to create jobs for hard working families.

Tonight my team was delighted to attend the swearing in for the new Mayor of Rowlett, Tammy Dana-Bashian and the new City Council Members. My team and I are looking forward to working with you all. I would also like to thank outgoing Mayor Todd Gottel and the outgoing council members for their service and commitment to the people of Rowlett. You all make North Texas proud.

Dangerous thugs who are criminal illegal aliens have no business on our streets and no place in our communities. I proudly supported H.R. 3697, the Criminal Alien Gang Member Removal Act, because I believe that we must make every effort to protect our families by lawfully removing these dangerous, illegal criminals.

Thank you to the Dallas Lighthouse for the Blind for their continued commitment to helping North Texans who are visually impaired. I was delighted to visit their new facility in Richardson this morning.

In the heart of Uptown Dallas, a medical device making clinical research team has broken though the barriers of light to see inside the human body. Spectral MD has created a leading edge technology that captures photon-tissue interactions underneath the skin's surface through a non-invasive imaging system. This impressive device allows professionals to more accurately categorize, and therefore, treat a burn or a wound in a timely fashion improving outcomes for all patients. I was delighted to learn more about their efforts and I am proud to have this leading edge company in the 32nd Congressional District of Texas.

This morning I was delighted to welcome students from the Dallas Independent School District who came to Washington this week on behalf of SkillsUSA. These young leaders are the future of our great nation and it was wonderful to see them taking an active role in improving the quality of our workforce.

For the past seven years the Maternal, Infant and Early Childhood Home Visiting program has responsibly used tax payer dollars to make a significant impact on some of the most vulnerable in our community. This program has made it possible for local, state, and federal officials to work together to help at-risk children and families while ensuring hard earned tax pay dollars are used responsibly and effectively. I proudly voted to reauthorize this evidence-based program to continue to give these families and children the opportunity to build a better life.

American families need a tax code that is fairer, flatter, and simpler. When my son Alex was born with Down syndrome there was never a question in my mind of whether or not his life was in the balance. I knew that he would be my most precious gift, and now at age 23 he has grown to be an Eagle Scout, a stellar athlete, and the coolest guy I know. I have always held the firm conviction and belief that every single life is precious and that God has created each and every one of us in his likeness and image. That is why I proudly cast my vote today to protect the innocent gifts from God who are most vulnerable and honor the sanctity of life.

As a unified republican government we finally have a real opportunity to get our fiscal house in order. While this is not an easy task, today’s resolution puts forth a responsible framework that balances the budget within 10 years – without raising taxes – by cutting spending, making necessary reforms, and growing the economy. We have a responsibility to get our country back on track and that starts with getting our fiscal house in order. I proudly supported this budget resolution to restore fiscal sanity in our government, unleash the free enterprise system, and ensure our kids and grandchildren have the opportunities they need and deserve to thrive in our great nation.  Read my full statement here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-statement-fy-2018-budget-resolution

This week one of my team members, Piper Vaughn, served as principal for the day in Anne Frank Elementary School in Dallas. Piper, thank you for representing Team Sessions and for thanking our North Texas educators for their invaluable contribution to our young leaders.

As the proud father of a Down syndrome young man, I have continuously worked with my colleagues and organizations, including the National Down Syndrome Society, to provide all individuals with disabilities the chance to break through the glass ceiling and reach their full potential. I am delighted to join my colleagues in a working group to put an end to #LawSyndrome and give these amazing individuals the opportunities they need and deserve to succeed.

For more than 30 years, Nortex Wholesale Nursery has been a staple in the Dallas community and has now set its roots in Wylie, Texas where they provide retailers, landscapers, and industry wholesalers with beautiful, quality flowers and plants year round. While small businesses are extremely important in our communities, they face a myriad of challenges ranging from onerous federal regulations to uncertainty with our tax code. As a fierce defender of the free enterprise system I will work to break the bureaucratic shackles on these job creators and give them the opportunity to continue to grow and thrive.
I was delighted to visit Fire Station 5 in Richardson this week to see their operation and thank the brave men and women who keep our communities safe.

This week I had the opportunity to tour the Seeboost facility in Richardson. I am proud to have such an innovative company in North Texas to help lead the way in making effective and affordable glasses that could make a huge difference in the lives of people with visual impairments.

While I was unable to attend this morning's celebration, I am delighted that the day has come where this coin is becoming a reality. After two years of hard work, I am honored to have led this initiative with Congresswoman Carolyn Maloney to support the efforts of The Breast Cancer Research Foundation and help raise millions of dollars for research. Far too many of our mothers, wives, sisters, family members, and friends have lost their lives from this devastating disease, but with this new coin, we will hopefully defeat breast cancer once and for all.

As a result of an in depth investigation led by the House Judiciary Committee, we learned that the Department of Justice repeatedly subverted Congressional spending authority by using settlements from financial institutions to pay partisan third party groups. Money from these settlements should go to the real victims, not partisan organizations. It is unfortunate that for the past eight years we had an Administration who was more interested in lining the pockets of their liberal friends than following the Constitution, but now is the time to restore the balance of power by ensuring no future Administration can use this tactic to abuse the system. The passage of H.R. 732, the Stop Settlement Slush Funds Act of 2017 is a victory for our Constitution and a victory for Americans like me who are sick and tired of the fraud and abuse that runs rampant in our government.  Read my full statement here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-votes-stop-settlement-slush-funds

Throughout Congressman Jeb Hensarling's time in Congress he has always been a conservative, principled leader. His family has always been his biggest supporters and Karen and I wish them nothing but the best. I look forward to continuing to work by his side through the 115th Congress.

It is inconceivable to think that someone could go into a place of worship where families and friends are gathering in prayer and commit such a senseless act of violence. My deepest prayers and condolences are with the entire Sutherland community.

Federal overreach and convoluted, job-killing regulations were the hallmark of the Obama Administration. So it is not a surprise that under their direction unelected bureaucrats at the National Labor Relations Board injected themselves where they don’t belong – squarely in the middle of the employer-employee relationship. Their actions blurred the lines of responsibility of joint employers for decisions that specifically impact the day-to-day operations of local businesses. In addition to creating an immense amount of confusion, this misguided decision also jeopardized 1.7 million American jobs. Yesterday, I proudly voted  to clarify the definition of a joint employer to protect local businesses from future overreach.   Read my full statement here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-votes-protect-american-job-creators

It recently came to my attention that the U.S. Department of Labor made a misguided decision to cut slots to the critical Job Corps program despite an increase in their funding. This morning I sent a letter to Secretary Acosta asking him to reevaluate their plan. I am pleased to announce that after receiving my letter, the Department rescinded their plan to cut slots. This program is so important for individuals across the country and I applaud the Department for listening to my request and reversing their decision.  Read my full statement here: sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-protects-job-corps-program
Proud to join my fellow Texans in honoring our nation’s veterans at the Dallas Veterans Day parade.

This week the House will vote on a tax reform package that will reinvigorate our economy, create more good-paying full-time jobs, and help American families keep more of their hard earned pay checks.   Learn more about the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act here: https://waysandmeansforms.house.gov/uploadedfiles/what_you_need_to_know.pdf

This evening at 5:30 PM CST I will be Chairing the Rules Committee hearing on H.R. 1, the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.   Watch the hearing LIVE here: https://rules.house.gov/video/rules-committee-hearing-hr-1-0

Back home, I hear stories each and every day from families who move to Dallas for a better opportunity to be winners in our economy. In Texas, we believe that fewer regulations, lower taxes, and more freedom are the keys to success. This pro-growth, bold package takes the same approach – lower taxes on families, lower taxes on American businesses, and more opportunities for success.

‪Each year I give thanks for our men and women in uniform, our first responders who protect our communities, and all of our many blessings. ‬As we come together with our family and friends today, I hope everyone pauses to reflect on the many gifts that God has blessed us with. Happy Thanksgiving!
Check out this week's House Floor schedule.

This evening I proudly voted to take a critical step towards reforming our nation's broken tax code. The American people deserve a tax code that allows them to keep more of their hard-earned money. American businesses desperately need a tax code that allows them to be competitive in the global marketplace as well as allows them to grow their businesses and create new jobs for hard working Americans. Our tax plan will create a fairer, flatter, simpler system that will benefit American families, businesses, and our economy.  I look forward to seeing our conferees get together to bring the best ideas to the table so we can send a comprehensive, pro-growth tax package to the President's desk.

This morning at 7 AM CST  I will be joining The Mark Davis Show on 660 AM The Answer to discuss tax reform, the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act, and more.   Listen LIVE here: http://saleminteractivemedia.com/listenlive/player/kskyam

Last month a tight knit community in my home state of Texas was devastated by a deranged, murderous individual who took the lives of dozens of innocent men, women, and children in a place of worship. During this horrific act, a law abiding citizen heard the shots and jumped into action to save the few lives that were remaining. Because of his bravery and his 2nd Amendment right he was able to protect himself as well as the others in that church.  I have always believed that our communities are safer because of these Good Samaritans who responsibly and lawfully keep and bear arms. That is why I proudly supported H.R. 38, the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act because it­ not only ensures that an individual’s right to carry doesn’t stop at state lines but it also strengthens the National Instant Criminal Background Check System to prevent a lapse in the system like the one that occurred with the Sutherland shooter.

Last month I proudly joined my House colleagues in responsibly acting to reauthorize the critical CHIP program and ensure that millions of children across the country would not be at risk for losing their health insurance. During our Rules Committee hearing yesterday my dear friend, colleague, and the Chairman of the Energy and Commerce’s Health Subcommittee, Congressman Michael Burgess explained why this important measure has yet to be reauthorized - the Senate. It has been 33 days since we sent a five year reauthorization of this program to the Senate. Under the leadership of Congressman Burgess we have completed our work, now it’s the Senate's turn to act.   Watch the full clip of Congressman Burgess here: https://youtu.be/LD9lKhix3uQ

For the past decade I have been working with my colleagues to research, study, and better understand how hyperbaric oxygen therapy could help treat injuries for our nation's veterans. I am delighted with the VA’s decision to offer this life saving treatment to our nation’s heroes and I look forward to continuing to work with them on this important issue.  Read my joint statement applauding this recent decision here: https://sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sessions-buck-and-jones-make-hyperbaric-oxygen-therapy-reality-our

This morning I️ was delighted to congratulate two bright young Wylie High students for winning this year’s Congressional App Competition. Check out their app here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mEbrENn1Qw&feature=youtu.be

This week the House and the Senate will take a historic step to reform our nation's broken tax code. American families and American businesses need relief and this package will provide it to them. Read more about the bill we are voting on this week here: https://waysandmeans.house.gov/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/TCJA_Conference121517.pdf

Yesterday I had the opportunity to participate in a meeting with the Texas and Florida delegations to review the newest supplemental funding package for disaster relief. This package responsibly targets funds to programs to continue relief and recovery efforts in all communitties that were impacted by natural disasters this fall. My colleagues and I have fought tirelessly to provide our neighbors with the support and resources that they need to rebuild their lives and get back on their feet. I proudly support this package and urge my colleagues to ensure we pass this before the end of the year.   Read more about this important package here: https://appropriations.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=395078

Today is a historic day. With the passage of this tax package we are breaking through the shackles of bureaucracy, unleashing the free enterprise system, and ringing in a new era of opportunity and freedom. When Americans put us in office, they did so with the understanding that we would help make America great again. Well, we are making Americans great again. We are giving them a tax system that works for them.  A system that allows them to take home more of their hard-earned money and have more opportunities for success. Today we made the big deal the big deal and delivered a win for American families, a win for American businesses, and a win for our economy.  Read my full statement applauding the passage of this monumental legislation here: https://sessions.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/we-made-big-deal-big-deal

This morning I’m chairing the Rules Committee hearing on a critical package to provide relief for communities impacted by the devastating natural disasters this year. We are also considering a short term funding package that ensures CHIP would be funded through March, provides resources for our military, and funds the VA Choice program.   Watch the hearing now on C-SPAN or online here: https://rules.house.gov/video/rules-committee-hearing-hr-4667-and-senate-amendment-hr-1370
